titleStmt.title: Cambridge Massachusetts, Harvard Law School, MS 33.

history.provenance: Provenance: 4th and 5th earls of Ashburnham; sold to George Dunn, Sotheby’s 1 May 1899, no. 118.

listBibl.bibl: Bibliography: HMC, 8th Report, p. 73; Barrois Collection, p. 205; De Ricci, p. 1028–9, no. 33; ELMUSA, p. 22.

body.p:
Cambridge, Massachusetts, Harvard Law School
MS 33. Magna carta with statutes; tracts. 341 ff. 240 x 150 mm.
Provenance: 4th and 5th earls of Ashburnham; sold to George Dunn, Sotheby’s 1 May 1899, no. 118.
Bibliography: HMC, 8th Report, p. 73; Barrois Collection, p. 205; De Ricci, p. 1028–9, no. 33; ELMUSA, p. 22.
MS 36. Magna carta with statutes; register of writs; tracts, incl. Opinio Angeri de Ripon. 106 ff. 220 x 150 mm.
Provenance: Alfred John Horwood (d. 1881); John Hirst; Reader; George Dunn.
Bibliography: De Ricci, p. 1029, no. 36; ELMUSA, pp. 22–3.
